org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.power

Class PowerDatacenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSimEntity
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.DatacenterSimple
        • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.power.PowerDatacenter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Runnable, Identificable, Nameable, SimEntity, Datacenter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PowerDatacenterNonPowerAware

    public class PowerDatacenter
extends DatacenterSimple
    PowerDatacenter is a class that enables simulation of power-aware data centers.
    If you are using any algorithms, policies or workload included in the power package please cite the following paper:
    • Anton Beloglazov, and Rajkumar Buyya, "Optimal Online Deterministic Algorithms and Adaptive Heuristics for Energy and Performance Efficient Dynamic Consolidation of Virtual Machines in Cloud Data Centers", Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experience (CCPE), Volume 24, Issue 13, Pages: 1397-1420, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd, New York, USA, 2012
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 2.0
    Author:
    Anton Beloglazov

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerDatacenter

        public PowerDatacenter(CloudSim simulation,
                       DatacenterCharacteristics characteristics,
                       VmAllocationPolicy vmAllocationPolicy)
        Creates a PowerDatacenter.
        Parameters:
        simulation - The CloudSim instance that represents the simulation the Entity is related to
        characteristics - the characteristics of the switches to be created
        vmAllocationPolicy - the policy to be used to allocate VMs into hosts

      • PowerDatacenter

        @Deprecated
public PowerDatacenter(CloudSim simulation,
                                   DatacenterCharacteristics characteristics,
                                   VmAllocationPolicy vmAllocationPolicy,
                                   List<FileStorage> storageList,
                                   double schedulingInterval)
        Deprecated. Use the other available constructors with less parameters and set the remaining ones using the respective setters. This constructor will be removed in future versions.
        Creates a PowerDatacenter with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        simulation - The CloudSim instance that represents the simulation the Entity is related to
        characteristics - the characteristics of the switches to be created
        vmAllocationPolicy - the policy to be used to allocate VMs into hosts
        storageList - a List of storage elements, for data simulation
        schedulingInterval - the scheduling delay to process each switches received event

    • Method Detail

      • updateCloudletProcessing

        protected void updateCloudletProcessing()
        Description copied from class: DatacenterSimple
        Updates processing of each cloudlet running in this DatacenterSimple and schedules the next processing update. It is necessary because Hosts and VMs are simple objects, not entities. So, they don't receive events and updating cloudlets inside them must be called from the outside.
        Overrides:
        updateCloudletProcessing in class DatacenterSimple

      • updateCloudetProcessingWithoutSchedulingFutureEventsIfClockWasUpdated

        protected double updateCloudetProcessingWithoutSchedulingFutureEventsIfClockWasUpdated()
        Update cloudet processing without scheduling future events just when the simulation clock is ahead of the last time some event was processed.
        Returns:
        expected time of completion of the next cloudlet in all VMs of all hosts or Double.MAX_VALUE if there is no future events expected in this host
        See Also:
        updateCloudetProcessingWithoutSchedulingFutureEvents()

      • updateCloudetProcessingWithoutSchedulingFutureEvents

        protected double updateCloudetProcessingWithoutSchedulingFutureEvents()
        Update cloudet processing without scheduling future events.
        Returns:
        expected time of completion of the next cloudlet in all VMs of all hosts or Double.MAX_VALUE if there is no future events expected in this host

      • processVmMigrate

        protected void processVmMigrate(SimEvent ev,
                                boolean ack)
        Description copied from class: DatacenterSimple
        Process the event for a Broker thta wants to migrate a VM. This DatacenterSimple will then send the status back to the Broker.
        Overrides:
        processVmMigrate in class DatacenterSimple
        Parameters:
        ev - information about the event just happened
        ack - indicates if the event's sender expects to receive an acknowledge message when the event finishes to be processed
